009package imagingbook.pub.hough.lines;
010
011import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.awt.Shape;
014import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
015import java.util.Locale;
016
017import ij.gui.Roi;
018import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
019import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
020import imagingbook.pub.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
021import imagingbook.pub.geometry.line.HessianLine;
022
023/**
024 * This class represents a straight line used by the Hough transform
025 * (see {@link imagingbook.pub.hough.HoughTransformLines}).
026 * It inherits from {@link HessianLine} which is, in turn, a subclass of 
027 * {@link AlgebraicLine}.
028 * It adds an arbitrary reference point and a counter for pixel votes.
029 */
030public class HoughLine extends HessianLine implements Comparable<HoughLine> {
031        
032        private final int count;                        // pixel votes for this line
033        private final double xRef, yRef;        // reference point
034        
035        
036        // static factory methods -------------------------------
037        
038        public static HoughLine fromPoints(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2, Pnt2d pRef, int count) {
039                return new HoughLine(AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2), pRef.getX(), pRef.getY(), count);
040        }
041        
042        // constructors -----------------------------------------
043        
044        public HoughLine(double a, double b, double c, double xR, double yR, int count) {
045                super(a, b, c);
046                this.xRef = xR;
047                this.yRef = yR;
048                this.count = count;
049        }
050
051        /**
052         * Constructor.
053         * @param angle the line's normal angle (see {@link HessianLine})
054         * @param radius the line's radius (distance to reference point)
055         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
056         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
057         * @param count pixel votes for this line
058         */
059        public HoughLine(double angle, double radius, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
060                super(angle, radius);
061                this.xRef = xRef;
062                this.yRef = yRef;
063                this.count = count;
064        }
065        
066        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line) {
067                this(line, 0.0, 0.0, 0);
068        }
069        
070        /**
071         * Constructor. 
072         * Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from a given
073         * {@link AlgebraicLine} (or any subclass) instance.
074         * The line parameters are adjusted to the specified reference point
075         * (actually only parameter c is modified, since a change of reference point
076         * effects only a shift of the line).
077         * The two lines are equivalent, i.e., contain the same points (x,y).
078         * Thus the distance from a given point (x,y) is the same from the original
079         * line and the new line.
080         * @param line an existing line ({@link AlgebraicLine} or subclass)
081         * @param xR reference point x-coordinate
082         * @param yR reference point y-coordinate
083         * @param count pixel votes for this line
084         */
085        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line, double xR, double yR, int count) {
086                super(line.getA(),
087                          line.getB(),
088                          line.getC() + line.getA()*(xR-line.getXref()) + line.getB()*(yR-line.getYref())); // = a', b', c'
089                this.xRef = xR;
090                this.yRef = yR;
091                this.count = count;
092        }
093        
094        // getter/setter methods ------------------------------------------
095        
096        /**
097         * @return The accumulator count associated with this line.
098         */
099        public int getCount() {
100                return count;
101        }
102        
103        @Override
104        public double getXref() {
105                return xRef;
106        }
107        
108        @Override
109        public double getYref() {
110                return yRef;
111        }
112        
113        // other methods ------------------------------------------
114        
115        /**
116         * Required by the {@link Comparable} interface, used for sorting lines by their
117         * point count (in descending order, i.e., strong lines come first).
118         * @param other another {@link HoughLine} instance.
119         */
120        @Override
121        public int compareTo(HoughLine other) {
122                return Integer.compare(other.count, this.count);
123        }
124        
125        @Override
126        public String toString() {
127                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f, xRef = %.3f, yRef = %.3f, count = %d>",
128                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getAngle(), getRadius(), getXref(), getYref(), count);
129        }
130        
131        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
132        
133        public Shape getShape(int width, int height) {
134                double xRef = this.getXref();
135                double yRef = this.getYref();
136                double length = Math.sqrt(sqr(width) + sqr(height));
137                double angle = this.getAngle();
138                double radius = this.getRadius();
139                // unit vector perpendicular to the line
140                double dx = Math.cos(angle);    
141                double dy = Math.sin(angle);
142                // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
143                double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
144                double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
145                // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
146                double x1 = x0 + dy * length;
147                double y1 = y0 - dx * length;
148                double x2 = x0 - dy * length;
149                double y2 = y0 + dx * length;
150                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
151                path.moveTo(x1, y1);
152                path.lineTo(x2, y2);
153                return path;
154        }
155
156//      /**
157//       * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
158//       * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}). The length of the displayed line 
159//       * is equivalent to the distance of the reference point (typically the
160//       * image center) to the coordinate origin.
161//       * @return the new line
162//       * @deprecated
163//       */
164//      public PolygonRoi makeLineRoi() {
165//              double length = Math.sqrt(xRef * xRef + yRef * yRef);
166//              return this.makeLineRoi(length);
167//      }
168        
169//      /**
170//       * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
171//       * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}). The length of the displayed line 
172//       * is measured from its center point (the point closest to the reference
173//       * point) in both directions.
174//       * 
175//       * @param length the length of the line
176//       * @return the new line
177//       */
178//      public PolygonRoi makeLineRoi(double length) {
179//              // unit vector perpendicular to the line
180//              double dx = Math.cos(angle);    
181//              double dy = Math.sin(angle);
182//              // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
183//              double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
184//              double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
185//              // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
186//              float x1 = (float) (x0 + dy * length);
187//              float y1 = (float) (y0 - dx * length);
188//              float x2 = (float) (x0 - dy * length);
189//              float y2 = (float) (y0 + dx * length);
190//              float[] xpoints = { x1, x2 };
191//              float[] ypoints = { y1, y2 };
192//              return new PolygonRoi(xpoints, ypoints, Roi.POLYLINE);
193//      }
194
195}
